hook.text: What if you could prove you're over 21 without revealing your birthdate? That's a zero-knowledge proof.

buildup.text: In cryptography, a zero-knowledge proof lets you verify a fact without revealing any underlying data.

discovery.text: Think of a colorblind friend: you can prove two balls are different colors without saying which is which.

twist.text: This tech could transform identity: prove citizenship without a passport number, income without a pay stub.

climax.text: Zero-knowledge proofs flip the model. Instead of oversharing to prove yourself, you share only the yes or no.

punchline.text: Proof without revelation. That's the future of privacy.

quiz.question: What does a zero-knowledge proof allow?
options: Proving a fact without revealing the underlying data
Hiding your identity from all law enforcement
